TV SHOW DATA

Original title: Los pazos de Ulloa

Production Year: 2006

For:: Divisa Home Video

Synopsis: Julian, a young inexperienced priest, arrives at Pazos de Ulloa to help Don Pedro manage his household. The young priest soon discovers that behind the noble facade lies disaster, ruin, and worst of all, sin.
TVE spared no expense in making this magnificent adaptation for television, really worthy of the novel, with the best actors available at the time, and some, like Victoria Abril, who were to become much more widely known later. The photography is sumptuous, bringing out all the beauty of the region of Galicia in the extreme north-west of Spain. A `pazo&#039; is a large country manor house where the landed gentry and their servants administered their lands and governed the peasants. For the discerning and well-versed viewer, `Los Pazos de Ulloa&#039; is a must, as are also the other series named above. If it should come up on any of your local television stations, I thoroughly recommend the time and effort: you will perceive a good bit of European cultural background based on excellent literary work.

For more information : http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0089787/
